Posts.Content: Sascha rose, you are not a wimp & this is not a trivial matter. When I had my rads they were very descreet. I was never completely naked on top. I can't believe they treated you tat way & I am so sorry of the indiginity you had to suffer through. I hope you have gotten them to cover you up & you get through it better. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: Is RADS always like this?

Posts.Content: Smoking is a crutch & habit. Every thing you do comes with a reason to light that cig. I know it well. I smoked from teen years til I was 33. I quit cold turkey because I found out I was finally pregnant. I could never light one up now because I'd never stop. I will miss smoking til the day I die. My husband finally quit but still chews Nicorette which to me is if he stops chewing it he will start up again. I sent him outside while he smoked. Please keep trying. I have bc wit mets. It is too late for me but not for you! Good luck & stay strong. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: BC and smoking

Posts.Content: Hello Pollycat, it took me 2 yrs. to tell my family I had BC "again"my mom was sick & my older sister was also battling & they knew about her fight. Since then both have passed & everybody knows my situation; mostly. I have told them as much as they need to know without completely so scared for me. One day at a time I now live by. When I get my scans & tell them the results & they are satisfied with what I tell them. Good luck with all your treatments & tests. Yes, it is a lot to process.
Posts.Title: Post-surgery results and treatment plan ...

Posts.Content: Sascha, you poor girl. You really get put thru hell & back. Do you take anything ahead of time for your nerves. I couldn't function without lorazepam just to take the edge off. I sure hope next time goes smoother for you. Good luck. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: Deja vu ????

Posts.Content: Hi Louise, what does your age have to do with if you get chemo or not.  I am 58 and just now getting it. There was no question about my age.  I had a lumpectomy in 2004 with 100% node clearance.  I had had 5 wks. of radiation only.  I never saw an oncologist; only a radiologist.  In 2007 I had a recurrence with stage IV breast cancer.  I had had only a 1% chance of recurrence.  It runs highly in my family so I was not surprised. I was on Tamoxifen and Femara for a year each.  It has spread to my lung now and the time came to start chemo.  All the thoughts that went through my head for a time being was why had it come back.  There are no answers.  But my thinking is if I had had chemotherapy it may have killed the stray mutant cell and I wouldn't be in this situation now. It's a lot to think about and very scary but I just had my 7th round and I'm doing fine.  Don't mean to scare you but it's just a thought.  Good luck with your decision.  Ask lots of question.   Marilyn
Posts.Title: Confused.......

Posts.Content: Annabel, dehydration can zap your energy big time. Happened to me where I needed the wheelchair because I couldn't stand from being so weak & fragile. They gave me fluids & it was amazing how it worked. I hope that's all it is. Sorry you are so miserable. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: Going to ward tomorrow

Posts.Content: I can totally understand why you got so attached! Won Wonderful news for you. Sorry you now have to go through chemo But sounds like you will do fine. Good luck & BIG HUGS to you. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: Nine eggs on ice!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Annebel, four mos. ago I adopted a kitten & it's the best medicine I could have given myself. I fell in live as soon as I saw her & she's been the best friend anybody could have :) good thing about cats is no walking them. Bad thing is the cwt box :p. have fun on holiday & enjoy your new pup. All the best, marilyn
Posts.Title: Bought a puppy :)

Posts.Content: Hi Annebel, four mos. ago I adopted a kitten & it's the best medicine I could have given myself. I fell in live as soon as I saw her & she's been the best friend anybody could have :) good thing about cats is no walking them. Bad thing is the cwt box :p. have fun on holiday & enjoy your new pup. All the best, marilyn
Posts.Title: Bought a puppy :)

Posts.Content: Radiotherapy is a walk in the park compared to chemo. In 2004 I had 30 rad treatments & all I got was very sunburnt like skin. There are all sorts of ointments to help with that. For me aloe & vitamin E worked the best. I just had my sixth round of chemotherapy. No comparison to the horrid side affects. Don't know where you heard that about radiation being worse. The worst part is getting set up & the anticipation of it all. You will be fine. Good luck.
Posts.Title: starting radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hello Lyndy1802, sorry you have to be here but it's a wonderful site for information & new friendships. I am 59 & in the states. I have a different situation than yours but have been thru a lumpectomy & rads & a recurrence & have again been thru rads & been on different chemos for a yr now. I will help in anyway I can. Good luck thru your journey. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: Hello, I'm a newbie

Posts.Content: On my first round with chemo I had it administered in my arm. On my last walk to the restroom I noticed a pinching and thought it was the tape sticking to the hairs on my arm.  When I sat back down a nurse looked at my arm and said when did this happened and I looked down and my hand was starting to swell at the IV sight.  That was early Dec.  I've had nothing like what you're going through but it is still numb from where the needles went in down the vein.  They watched it for 5 days and asked a lot of questions.  They were concerned but didn't tell me what could have happened.  They still ask about it but I think I will be ok.  IT IS A BIG DEAL and they need to keep at it with you.  I have heard one story from a nurse at another clinic about what happened to a patient.  Her dr. paid all her medical expenses pertaining to that mistake.  (I am in the US) Good luck with your recovery. You're not alone.
Posts.Title: ghastly chemo injury

Posts.Content: I had 6 wks of radiotherapy after my lumpectomy. I worked thru it with no problem. I would go every day after work. There was only one day where I felt so lousy & I left work early. It is very doable. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: Radiotherapy Question

Posts.Content: Stel77, I stopped Abraxene in Sept. & started on xeloda on Oct. 29. I thought I would lose what was growing back but it has kept growing.
Posts.Title: curly hair

Posts.Content: Hi Annie, did you have any radiation on your lung? I did & am crackly & wheezy from it. Asked the dr & he said it from scar tissue & things breaking up while healing from the rads. Also when I was on a certain chemo it gave me bad heartburn & I would wheeze until the stomach meds kicked in. Hope this helped but ask your dr if you are anxious about it. Marilyn x
Posts.Title: crackly and wheezy

Posts.Content: My hair came crack completely grey & curly. I had a nice wave to my hair but never curls. I'm wondering if the curls will relax when it gets longer. I have very thick hair. It it now about 1 1/2 inches long. I'm thinking of integrating some color into it; not to drastic anymore. I am 59. Marilyn
Posts.Title: curly hair

Posts.Content: Annie, same frame of mind here. Know it well hugs Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: crackly and wheezy

Posts.Content: Hi kittycat, I ha 35 rad treatments & they were every day with weekends off as well. Sounds like a lot but that's the usual dosage. The bone scan is a pc. of cake. The injection is a little scary but you don't feel a think except for the injection. I've never heard of being radioactive though. You just lay there & it's an open machine & it starts at one end & scans you from head to toe on top & then on the backside of you. The unknown is always scary. I've done it all do I don't freak out anymore. If someone is going to drive you you could take a Lorazapam ahead of time to calm your nerves. Check with them first to make sure you can have it beforehand. Good luck! Ps love your kitty>^••^
Posts.Title: My results

Posts.Content: Sasha, you belong here just like everybody else does. There are so many different treatments out there & it is up to you & your well being to choose what's right for you. No one should feel threatened by your choice. I have mets & feel different than everybody. I don't post much but read it all . I am also in the US. Please stay & feel welcomed by all. Good luck thru your journey. Marilyn x
Posts.Title: Not sure if I still belong here or not?

Posts.Content: Hi Carol, IMHO you became a survivor the day they took it out of you. I say I was a survivor for 4 1/2 yrs. until I had a recurrence, which was very rare in my circumstances. I did not go thru chemo. Even in treatment you are a survivor. With all I have been thru I sure am a survivor & still surviving it all. Best regards, Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: When does survival start officially?

Posts.Content: I will never take my husband for granted again. He has come to every appt., driven me to every treatment, has been a godsend. He is much stronger than I could have imagined. He never complains about anything. He massages me in the middle of the night when I can't sleep. I couldn't imagine life without him. I am vey lucky to have him as my husband & partner for "life".
Posts.Title: Living alone

Posts.Content: Hello Annibel, I have mets on my lung too.  I've been going thru this for 7 mos. now.  The chemo I am on has started to work to shrink the mets.  I am HR+ though so don't know if it makes a difference.  It's al one medicine that works on it all.  I have many low days but try and talk myself out of the depression because I know many more people worse off than me.  I have been sick a lot and they are now changing my meds because they think I've developed a toxicity to to chemo.  Next Wed. I start something new that should not be so harsh on my system but I am still pretty worried.  All I know is I trust the people administering it al to me and my health is in their hands.  I hope you have wonderful help as well.  Good luck with the rest of your journey. Hope you have more positive than negative days to come.   Marilyn
Posts.Title: Triple negative and lung mets, is there any hope? :(

Posts.Content: Lisa, I have had many things happen since on treatment that has never happened in my life. I've had pneumonia twice, a virus & today I had to have a blood transfusion because the chemo treatment made me anemic. I've had to give samples of everything imaginable. I try not to panic each time something new comes up. I have just realized how very susceptible we are while we are being treated & we have to be as careful as possible to stay healthy. If I don't understand something I try to ask then what they ate talking about. Sometimes I feel foolish but it's better to know than not know. Good luck with your results. Take care of yourself! Marilyn
Posts.Title: Help, I'm worrying myself sick!!!

Posts.Content: Ethel, I agree with having a portacath. It's the best thing I could have done. No digging for veins anymore. No anxiety there. It's the way to go for bloodwork & chemo. I have had scans & they can't use it then but that is one vein I can give up for testing. Marilyn x
Posts.Title: Portacath experience: semi permanent line that is under the skin!...

Posts.Content: I had a cold & did nothing about it. I thought it had gains away except For a nagging cough. Wks. later I had scans done & they found pneumonia in my right lung. I was put on antibiotics a immediately. Your immune susytem is compromised by chemo & it lowers your ability to fight infection. Please Don't wait too long to get yourself checked out if it persists. In the states here we Have been taught to sneeze in the crook of the arm to lessen the spread of germs from the hands. Good luck. Marilyn
Posts.Title: help - what to do if i get a cold during chemo?

Posts.Content: The reason why I am here & asking is because I can't find an active breast cancer forum in the US.  I am looking for sisters with advanced breast cancer undergoing treatment now.  Thanks.   Marilyn
Posts.Title: Anybody here from the US or outside the UK?

Posts.Content: My worst days are day 4 & 5 and wish I could just sleep through them but I am running back and forth to the bathroom with the opposite of what you have.  I have to stay away from fruit and veggies due to my problem but sounds like you should try to eat more.  Week 2 for me starts to get back to normal but I still have to watch what I eat.  Sorry you feel so lousy.  There is light at the end of the tunnel.
Posts.Title: Do anybody feel like their body is shutting down 6 day after chem...

Posts.Content: I have secondaries in lung and liver.  Thanks for your reply.
Posts.Title: Anybody here from the US or outside the UK?

Posts.Content: Hi Annibel, is your chest infection pneumonia? I went the the clinic once in such bad shape they had to wheel me in a wheelchair. It was pneumonia that I didn't know how sick I was until being so weak. That time they gave me fluids & heavy duty antibiotics. The next time I got pneumonia I ended up in the hosp. On heart monitors & oxygen. I've now had a chest cold for over 2 wks. The cough will not go away. We are just so much more susceptible to germs & it hits us harder & it's harder to feel better. I'm sorry you had to miss your little ones school activities but you need to take care & rest & get better. I'm sure you will! Sending healing thoughts your way. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: had my 3rd tax and blood transfusion

Posts.Content: Hi Annabel, I know what you mean by too much alone time. My daughter's boyfriend is here from out of town & they just took off. My son & husband are out fishing & here I sit eating cold pizza. I am now on xeloda & it has really taken my appetite away & I am weak from not eating. All I want to do is sleep.,I did not get out if bed until 1 & then I didn't even want to move. It's one thing to have bc but to have to take these meds with so many side effects is so depressing. I have so much to do but I can't get motivated to start anything. And on top of it all I have an aching tooth & of course it's the weekend! So I know how you feel my friend. I hope today is somewhat better for you. Hope you can get some things done now that your hubby is off. Peace. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: had my 3rd tax and blood transfusion

Posts.Content: I am a member there but not very active at all.  Nobody has posted in weeks there :( Thanks anyway.  Will keep looking.
Posts.Title: Anybody here from the US or outside the UK?

Posts.Content: I am having a recurrence of breast cancer from 2004.  It has spread to my lymph glands.  They tell me it is not curable but it is very treatable.  I am now on IV chemo & chemo pills for the first time.  I think I should have had it the first time around.  I have gone through every emotion possible.  I go for chemo every 3 wks. and have nurse evals and bloodwork every wk.  2 wks. ago I was a basket case and had no idea why.  I was already through 2 infusions and knew what to expect.  I looked at the nurse and started balling & asked what was the matter with me.  She looked sympathetic and said "awww you know we won't hurt you" Then I saw the nurse practioner and he said the drugs have taken all my hormones and there's a lot to take in every week and it happens & that I'm not alone with my emotions. I've been fine since that day.  We all go through it and we all understand and we're here for you.  I'm newer here and am very happy I found this site.  Here's a BIG CYBER HUG from me to you.  Hope you feel bettr soon.   Marilyn
Posts.Title: Just need a hug

Posts.Content: Annie, no wonder you have been huffing & puffing! I have had it done 3 times; each time less fluid. There will be no pain so don't worry. Good luck & I hope that does the trick. Marilyn xx
Posts.Title: fluid filled lung

Posts.Content: Sascha, I understand you completely. I only communicated with her a few times but felt close to her. I really thought she was improving by her last post. We had similar medical issues so it was good to have her understand what i'm going through. I feel lost as well.
Posts.Title: Feels empty here

Posts.Content: Annibel, She should have never said that to you that way.  Some  people have no bedside manner at expressing themselves correctly without hurting the one they're talking too.  I have mets to my liver and lungs and I am here 4 yrs. & counting and not planning on going anywhere soon.  I hope this brings you some comfort in your heart and head.  There is so much out there not for us that wasn't there yrs. ago.  Good luck with the rest of your journey. God Bless.
Posts.Title: horrible onc appt, horrible news

Posts.Content: Good to know you are feeling better about things. My treatment was also cancelled but not due to my blood count but from pneumonia. I've had it, this time, for over a wk. & I went for a chest X-ray today & they didn't want to risk it. If I'm still too weak & they give it to me It could make it worse & i could end up in the hosp. I return on fri. & if i'm better they will start it then. If not we can wait one more week. My husband has been wonderful through this all. Sunday he leaves for a wk. & he's thinking about canceling his trip. I want him to go because his 83 yr. old mom needs him more. Hope things work out for you next wk. take care...Marilyn
Posts.Title: chemo delayed a week ..so upset

Posts.Content: We've got to keep our sense of humor through this.  It's the only thing that keeps me somewhat sane. Marilyn x
Posts.Title: has shaved my head ! :)

Posts.Content: I was first diagnosed in 2004 and rediagnosed 2009.  I did not go through chemo first time but am on it now.  I to recently shaved it off but have left about half inch on.  My whole life I've been known for my thick hair so it was devastating when it started coming out all over.  I cried my eyes out right before my daughter helped me shave it. I feel better since I did because it's not falling out all over and terribly itchy.  I just had my 3rd treatment and trying to get over the hump now.  Good luck through your journey. Marilyn
Posts.Title: has shaved my head ! :)
